headline: One more drops from GOP field for Pennsylvania governor
sentences: Even with Ciarrocchi's exit, the Republican primary field remains double-digits deep as GOP rivals vie for the nomination to take on the presumed Democratic nominee, two-term state Attorney General Josh Shapiro, in November's election.
Guy Ciarrocchi, who stepped down as president and CEO of the Chester County Chamber of Business and Industry to run, said Thursday that he is ending his campaign.
Candidates can begin circulating paperwork on Friday to gather the 2,000 voter signatures necessary to qualify for primary ballots across Pennsylvania.
Ciarrocchi is a long-time advocate for parochial and charter schools, and was a former congressional staffer and top aide to former Lt. Gov.

HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) â€”
Another candidate is dropping out of the crowded field for the GOP nomination for governor of Pennsylvania.

Video above: Republican candidates debate in Western Pa. (Jan. 12)
The primary election is May 17.
Tom Wolf, a second-term Democrat, is constitutionally restricted from serving a third term.
